amendment.description: Amendment authorizes 30 scholarships for Tibetan students and professionals who are outside of Tibet and 15 scholarships to Burmese students and professionals who are outside of Burma.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to direct the USIA, wherever practical, to consider individuals who are active in the preservation of Tibet's culture, language, and religion when granting scholar-ships under the Educational and Cultural Exchange program

vote.text: On agreeing to the Capps amendment (A034) Agreed to by voice vote.
